text: Parliamentary elections were held in Laos on 21 December 1997.Dieter Nohlen, Florian Grotz & Christof Hartmann (2001) Elections in Asia: A data handbook, Volume II, p135 A total of 159 candidates contested the 99 seats, all but four of which were Lao People's Revolutionary Party members. All candidates were pre-screened by the LPRP.Laos: Legislature at Country Studies The LPRP won 98 seats, with an independent winning the remaining seat.Laos: Elections held in 1997 Inter-Parliamentary Union Voter turnout was reported to be 99.4%. ==Results== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right !Alliance !Party !Votes !% !Candidates !Elected !+/– |- |rowspan=2 align=left|Lao Front for National Construction||align=left|Lao People's Revolutionary Party|| ||rowspan="2"|100 |155||98||+13 |- |align=left|Independents|| |4||1||+1 |- |align=left colspan=2|Invalid/blank votes|| ||– |–||–||– |- |align=left colspan=2|Total||2,284,632||100 |159||99||+14 |- |align=left colspan=2|Registered voters/turnout||2,299,128||99.36 |–||–||– |- | colspan="7" align="left" |Source: Nohlen et al. |} ==References== Category:1997 elections in Asia Category:Elections in Laos Category:1997 in Laos Category:One-party elections
title: 1997 Laotian parliamentary election
